H0.text: Muscle cells help skin feel heat and pressure.

H1.text: Blood cells help skin feel heat and pressure.

H2.text: Nerve cells help skin feel heat and pressure.

H3.text: Bone cells help skin feel heat and pressure.

A4.text: Mechanoreceptors are sensory receptors which respond to mechanical forces, such as pressure or distortion.

A5.text: Thermoreceptors are sensory receptors, which respond to varying temperatures.
